dcterms:creator: Prithviraj Sen
Galileo Namata
Mustafa Bilgic
Lise Getoor
Brian Galligher
Tina Eliassi-Rad
dcterms:description: Cora dataset contains 2,708 scientific publications classified into seven classes: case-based, genetic algorithms, neural networks, probabilistic methods, reinforcement learning, rule learning, and theory. Each paper in the citation network cites or is cited by at least one other paper, resulting in a total of 5,429 edges.
dcterms:title: Cora

dcterms:creator: Péter Mernyei
C˘at˘alina Cangea
dcterms:description: WikiCS dataset is a Wikipedia-based dataset designed for benchmarking Graph Neural Networks, consisting of 10 computer science branches as classes with high connectivity. Node features are derived from the corresponding article texts.
dcterms:title: WikiCS

dcterms:creator: C. Lee Giles
Kurt D. Bollacker
Steve Lawrence
dcterms:description: CiteSeer dataset comprises 3,186 scientific publications categorized into six areas: Agents, Machine Learning, Information Retrieval, Database, Human Computer Interaction, and Artificial Intelligence, with the task of classifying each paper based on its title and abstract.
dcterms:title: CiteSeer

dcterms:creator: Xiaoxin He
Xavier Bresson
Thomas Laurent
Adam Perold
Yann LeCun
Bryan Hooi
dcterms:description: ArXiv-2023 dataset is a directed graph representing the citation network of computer science arXiv papers published in 2023 or later. The goal is to classify each paper into one of 40 subject areas such as cs.AI, cs.LG, and cs.OS.
dcterms:title: ArXiv-2023

dcterms:creator: Jianmo Ni
Jiacheng Li
Julian McAuley
dcterms:description: Ele-Photo dataset consists of nodes representing electronics products, with edges indicating frequent co-purchases or co-views. Each node is labeled according to a three-level classification of electronics products.
dcterms:title: Ele-Photo

dcterms:creator: Will Hu
Matthias Fey
Marinka Zitnik
Yuxiao Dong
Hongyu Ren
Bowen Liu
Michele Catasta
Jure Leskovec
dcterms:description: OGBN-Products dataset is reduced using a node sampling strategy to create the OGBN-Products (subset) with 54k nodes and 74k edges. Each node represents an Amazon product, with edges denoting co-purchases.
dcterms:title: OGBN-Products (subset)

dcterms:creator: Will Hu
Matthias Fey
Marinka Zitnik
Yuxiao Dong
Hongyu Ren
Bowen Liu
Michele Catasta
Jure Leskovec
dcterms:description: OGBN-ArXiv dataset is a directed graph depicting the citation network among computer science arXiv papers indexed by MAG. The goal is to classify papers into one of 40 subject areas like cs.AI, cs.LG, and cs.OS.
dcterms:title: OGBN-ArXiv
